[Submission Guidelines](#submission-guidelines) ### Tender Information * **Title**: Life Cycle Assessment for Large and Complex Scientific Equipment * **Reference Number**: cb-758-9953471 * **Amendment Number**: 6 * **Solicitation Number**: 10077568 * **Publication Date**: January 19, 2024 * **Closing Date**: February 13, 2024, at 2 PM EST * **Trade Agreements**: Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement * **Contracting Entity**: Public Services and Procurement Canada * **Contact Information**: Eric Beadury, (873) 355-4728, eric.beaudry@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca ### Background The Government of Canada's Federal Sustainable Development Strategy outlines its sustainable development goals, which are supported by the Greening Government Strategy. This strategy aims to achieve net-zero carbon, climate-resilient, and green operations. Scientific laboratories are known to consume significantly more energy per square meter than office buildings, highlighting the need for improving the sustainability of federal laboratories. ### Objective This tender aims to identify life cycle assessment principles and develop new tools, guidelines, and targets to support the adoption of green procurement across the federal government. The objective is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions related to the procurement of scientific equipment in federal science laboratories. ### Requirements The selected supplier will be responsible for analyzing product-specific environmental impacts within the existing federal inventory of large and complex scientific equipment that have the Highest environmental impacts. The results will inform the development of procurement criteria to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. ### Submission Guidelines Please submit your proposals electronically through the Canada Bids website.
